|sessionend1 = July 16, 1832 |sessionnumber2 = 2nd |sessionstart2 = December 3,
1832 |sessionend2 = March 2, 1833 |previous = 21st |next = 23rd }} The 'Twenty-
second United States Congress' was a meeting of the legislative branch of the
United States federal government, consisting of the United States Senate and the
United States House of Representatives. It met in Washington, D.C. from March 4,
1831 to March 4, 1833, during the third and fourth years of Andrew Jackson's
presidency. The apportionment of seats in the House of Representatives was based
on the Fourth Census of the United States in 1820. Both chambers had a
Jacksonian majority.
